Hello, I am Jisu

a UXUI designer expereinced in front-end development focused on creating design systems for better digital expereiecnces.

I studied Digital Interactive Art at Emily Carr University. I began my career as a web product designer in the marketing department. My tasks involved delivering web-related products such as websites, marketing ads, event pages, etc. To enhance my UX design skills and communication abilities, I learned programming and marketing. After taking some courses, I built two web applications during my free time and also completed some projects for clients. Now, I am working as a UX/UI designer in the game industry. I enjoy solving problems in various industries.

My Design Principles

Strong conviction

Showing numbers helps to support the design and convince stakeholders therfore I find the data that can support my design. (It can be compeitor's profit numbers, or user conversion rate, testing with users, users reviews/ feedbacks.)

Thoughtful Complexity

I like to dive in coplexity challenges that require deep product thinking. Sometime get some ideas from non-related prouct, so I already keep eye on every time I use app/ web products, and also collaborating with others to bring clarity and alignment to design problems.

Process Oriented

When I worked in the marketing deapartment, I learned to be more result oriented. After becoming UX/UI designer, learned to be process oriented. I work closely with my collaborators to establish a process that works for all involved parties, while maining flexibility and adaptability to change the priorities and outcomes.

Favorite books

To gain a deeper understanding, I consistently seek new knowladge. The following books was especialy useful and interesting: "The Design of Everyday Things," "What Silicon Valley Does and Develops" by Chan Han, "1-10 Steps of UX and Product Planning Guide," and "Sell or Be Sold." One of my advantages is that I can access valuable UX/UI books written in both Korean and English. This helps me stay informed and informed about UX trends in various contexts.
